title: Executive Order 7489-Enlarging Elk Refuge in Wyoming
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me as President of the United States and by the act of June 25, 1910, ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847, as amended by the act of August 24, 1912, ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497, and subject to the conditions therein expressed and to all valid existing rights, it is ordered that the following-described public lands in Teton County, Wyoming, be, and they are hereby, reserved and set apart for the use of the Department of Agriculture, as an addition to the Elk Refuge:
The reservation made by this order supersedes the temporary withdrawals heretofore made for elk refuge classification in so far as they affect the abovedescribed lands.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7489-Enlarging Elk Refuge in Wyoming Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/356426
